revised_title: Nonlinear Dynamics of Engineering Systems: Stick-Slip Motion of Turbine Blade Dampers
tldr: This article investigates the stick-slip motion of turbine blade dampers, focusing on the nonlinear dynamics of engineering systems. The authors develop a mechanical model to study the behavior of dampers under various conditions, including sliding friction and stiction. They analyze the influence of supporting angles and centrifugal forces on the damper's performance and provide a comparison between theoretical predictions and experimental results.
